meanings.definition: In a way that is characteristic of or prone to illness or poor health.
meanings.sent1: She looked sickly after staying up all night.
meanings.sent2: The plant grew sickly in the dark corner of the room.
meanings.sent3: The sickly cat tried to chase a butterfly but ended up sneezing.
meanings.sent4: The sickly light of the dying candle flickered weakly in the room.
meanings.sent5: The sickly smell of rotten food made everyone nauseous.

meanings.definition: Causing or tending to cause sickness or ill health.
meanings.sent1: The sickly air in the old basement made her cough.
meanings.sent2: The sickly sweet scent of the flowers filled the room.
meanings.sent3: The sickly taste of the medicine made him cringe.
meanings.sent4: The sickly green color of the pond hinted at pollution.
meanings.sent5: The sickly child's pale face worried the parents.
